author: hwright
msg: Remove the access baton TYPE field altogether in favor of a single flag
which indicates whether or not the baton owns the lock.
(svn_wc_adm_access_t): Remove TYPE and LOCK_EXISTS fields, and replace with
(adm_access_alloc): Remove type param, replace with write_lock param, alloc
(close_single, svn_wc__adm_write_check): Just check the locked flag, rather
than the type and the lock exists cache.
(svn_wc_adm_locked, extend_lock_found_entry): Use the locked flag, rather

author: hwright
msg: Replace a CLOSED type in the access baton with a simple flag, separating the
issue of whether or not a baton is CLOSED from whether or not it is LOCKED.
(svn_wc_adm_access_t): Remove closed type, and add a closed boolean flag
Check the flag, not the type.

author: julianfoad
msg: Change the default value of the test suite's "--http-library" option back to
"neon". Document more carefully the option's meaning.
This reverts a part of the change I made in r39716, for backward compatibility
of the test suite interface, so that it still works e.g. in the build-bot that
builds svn with Neon only and then runs the test suite without specifying the
(usage): Clarify the meaning of --http-library in the help message.
